name: Reorder DAT
description: The Reorder DAT allows you to reorder the rows and columns of the input table. You can also use In Specified Order option to get duplicate copies of rows and columns.
summary: The Reorder DAT allows you to reorder the rows and columns of the input table. You can also use In Specified Order option to get duplicate copies of rows and columns.

parameters.name: Reorder
parameters.label: Reorder
parameters.description:
From Derivative
		
		
		
		
		Jump to navigation
		Jump to search
		
The Reorder  allows you to reorder the rows and columns of the input table. You can also use In Specified Order option to get duplicate copies of rows and columns.
reorderDAT_Class

Contents
 
 
 
 
 
 
 





  reorder -  - This parameter allows you to reorder either rows or columns.

 row - col -
		
  method -  - Specify how to reorder the table.

 reverse - Reverse the order rows or columns. replacenames - Copy a row or column in the input table specified in From to the row or column specified in To.  Rows or Columns are specified by names. replaceindices - Copy a row or column in the input table specified in From to the row or column specified in To.  Rows or Columns are specified by numbers. swapnames - Swap a row or column specified in From with the row or column specified in To. Rows or Columns are specified by names. Swaps are cumulative. swapindices - Swap a row or column specified in From with the row or column specified in To. Rows or Columns are specified by numbers. Swaps are cumulative. specifyname - Copy the rows or columns in the specified order by name. Any row or column not listed will be appended in input order. You can specify a row or column more than once to get multiple copies of it. specifyindex - Copy the rows or columns in the specified order by index. Any row or column not listed will be appended in input order. You can specify a row or column more than once to get multiple copies of it.
		
  before - The rows or columns to copy or swap from.


		
  after - The rows or columns to copy or swap to.


		
  order - The order of input rows and columns to copy.


		
  delete - Only available when Method is 'In Specified Order by Name' or 'In Specified Order by Index'. It will delete any row/column not listed in the Order parameter.





  language -  - Select how the  decides which script language to operate on.

 input - The  uses the inputs script language. node - The  uses it's own script language.

  extension -  - Select the file extension this  should expose to external editors.

 dat - various common file extensions. frag - glsl - html - md - py - rtf - tsv - txt - vert - xml - languageext - pick extension from DATs script language. customext - Specify a custom extension.

  customext - Specifiy the custom extension.



  wordwrap -  - Enable Word Wrap for Node Display.

 input - The  uses the inputs setting. on - Turn on Word Wrap. off - Turn off Word Wrap.



 -

Extra Information for the Reorder  can be accessed via an Info CHOP.



 - Number of rows in this . - Number of columns in this .
 - Number of times the operator has cooked since the process started. - Duration of the last cook in milliseconds. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the component timeline. - Frame number when this operator was last cooked relative to the absolute time. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator started cooking in the frame it was cooked. - Time in milliseconds at which the operator finished cooking in the frame it was cooked. - 1 if operator was cooked this frame. - Number of warnings in this operator if any. - Number of errors in this operator if any.
TouchDesigner Build: Latest\n2021.100002018.28070before 2018.28070
DATs
• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • 

An Operator Family that manipulates text strings: multi-line text or tables. Multi-line text is often a python Script or GLSL Shader, but can be any multi-line text. Tables are rows and columns of cells, each containing a text string.



The generic thing that holds an Operator, and includes Flags (display, bypass, lock, render, immune) and its position/size in the network. Whether you "lay down an Operator" or "lay down an Node", you're doing the same thing.



An Operator Family which operate on Channels (a sequence of numbers (Samples)) which are used for animation, audio, mathematics, simulation, logic, UI construction, and data streamed from/to devices and protocols.








Retrieved from "https://docs.derivative.ca/index.php?title=Reorder_DAT&oldid=24306"
		Category: DATs
